docs.snippet: It’s time to stop companies — like Amazon, Boeing and Coca-Cola — from damaging the economy by legally shirking taxes....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s time to stop companies — like Amazon, Boeing and Coca-Cola — from damaging the economy by legally shirking taxes.
docs.abstract: David Leonhardt Op-Ed cloumn argues corporate tax code reform should be top priority of next president.

headline.main: The Big Companies That Avoid Taxes

docs.snippet: The country made it clear it feared it was being sucked into an effort to “interfere in electoral processes” in the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: The country made it clear it feared it was being sucked into an effort to “interfere in electoral processes” in the United States.
docs.abstract: Ecuador cuts off internet access to Julian Assange, Wikileaks founder exiled in country's London embassy, citing fears of being involved by proxy in activities that could interfere with United States presidential election; announcement comes shortly after organization's leak of speeches Hillary Clinton delivered to Goldman Sachs.

headline.main: Ecuador Cuts Internet of Julian Assange, WikiLeaks’ Founder
headline.print_headline: Ecuador Cuts Assange’s Link to the Internet

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from London, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Nicholas Casey contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.
byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DAVID E. SANGER

docs.snippet: With a couple of breaks and more fortunate timing, many of the Vermont senator’s supporters believe that he really, truly could have been president....
docs.lead_paragraph: With a couple of breaks and more fortunate timing, many of the Vermont senator’s supporters believe that he really, truly could have been president.
docs.abstract: Release of hacked emails by WikiLeaks has supporters of Sen Bernie Sanders of Vermont reconsidering whether or not changes to his strategy would have had significant effect on outcome of Democratic primary; Sanders continues to campaign for Hillary Clinton, and calls on his supporters to look forward.

headline.main: In Hindsight, Backers of Bernie Sanders Lament What Might Have Been
headline.print_headline: Sanders Backers Rue an Opportunity Lost

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

docs.snippet: In March, a hacked email shows, Mrs. Clinton was presented with a “first cut” list of vice-presidential prospects by her campaign chairman....
docs.lead_paragraph: In March, a hacked email shows, Mrs. Clinton was presented with a “first cut” list of vice-presidential prospects by her campaign chairman.
docs.abstract: WikiLeaks reveals emails between Hillary Clinton and her presidential campaign chairman John D Podesta, sent well before she had captured nomination, offering list of possible vice presidential running mates; list includes former Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg and Clinton's former rival Bernie Sanders.

headline.main: No. 39 on Hillary Clinton’s Running Mate List: Bernie Sanders
